summary.para: Specifies the exceptions that will be allowed when expanding construction variables. By default, any construction variable expansions that generate a NameError or IndexError exception will expand to a '' (an empty string) and not cause scons to fail. All exceptions not in the specified list will generate an error message and terminate processing.
If &f-AllowSubstExceptions; is called multiple times, each call completely overwrites the previous list of allowed exceptions.
summary.example_commands:
# Requires that all construction variable names exist. # (You may wish to do this if you want to enforce strictly # that all construction variables must be defined before use.) AllowSubstExceptions()
# Also allow a string containing a zero-division expansion # like '${1 / 0}' to evalute to ''. AllowSubstExceptions(IndexError, NameError, ZeroDivisionError)
